p: The chemical class of terpenoids includes compounds widely distributed in plants and fruits and can be divided into two major groups: monoterpenes and sesquiterpenes or irregular terpenes, which are mostly synthesised in catabolic reactions and/or by autoxidation [ 155]. Geosmin ( Figure 15) is an irregular terpene, and its major sensory attributes, as referred to, are “earthy” and “freshly plowed soil”.
